720675f-d.text:
A(1)  James Street, east side, Worth from and including Madison Street, showing the St. James' Church (N.C.), adjoining, the N.E. corner of Madison  Street. Im this church, Alfred E. Smith, former Governor of New York State worshipped as a boy and young man. Also shown is a portion of the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated line on New Bowery.
September 9, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
A(2)  The same, showing a closer view of St. James' R.C. church.
About 1912.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg ~ i2:
A(3)  A contracted view of the same, showing only a detail of the church.
About 1912.
A(4)
James Street, East Side looking Northwards and showing the James Street Church. Steeple on church removed since photograph was taken.
Ju1y I928
George Balgue,
May be Reproduced.
Neg # 1127
720675f-d.folder: James Street & Madison Street, Manhattan, NY

720676f-a.text:
James Street, west side, north from Madison Street to New Bowery, showing the St. James' parochial school, at the N.W. corner of New Bowery.
September 9, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

47-49 Madison Street, north side, between James and Oliver Streets.
September 9, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
